meanings.definition: The process of forming or re-forming tribes.
meanings.sent1: The retribalization of the community brought people together in new ways.
meanings.sent2: The retribalization of the indigenous group led to stronger social bonds.
meanings.sent3: After the retribalization event, everyone started dressing in traditional attire.
meanings.sent4: The retribalization of the neighborhood transformed it into a close-knit tribe.
meanings.sent5: The retribalization of the society was a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of returning to a tribal way of life.
meanings.sent1: She embraced retribalization by living off the land and following ancient customs.
meanings.sent2: The retribalization of the family meant living in harmony with nature.
meanings.sent3: The retribalization journey involved learning to hunt and gather for survival.
meanings.sent4: His retribalization experience was like stepping back in time to a simpler life.
meanings.sent5: The retribalization process allowed them to reconnect with their roots.

meanings.definition: The revival of tribal customs and traditions.
meanings.sent1: The retribalization of the festival brought back ancient dances and rituals.
meanings.sent2: Their retribalization efforts focused on preserving traditional ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: During the retribalization celebration, everyone wore traditional face paint.
meanings.sent4: The retribalization movement aimed to honor the wisdom of tribal elders.
meanings.sent5: The retribalization of the culture breathed new life into old traditions.
